constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 21 (Thursday, February 4, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. LATTA:
H.R. 822.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 1:
The Congress shall have the Power to lay and collect Taxes,
Duties, Imposts and Excises, to pay Debts and provide for the
common Defense and general Welfare of the United States; but
all Duties, Imposts and Excises shall be uniform throughout
the United States.
[Page H387]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

title: Permanently Repeal the Estate Tax Act of 2021
